results.title: Burger Burger
results.creator_credit: Gavin Jun Jie Tan and Huang Shicong
results.brief_description: The story of a marooned explorer who meets some local wildlife, with a scary - but eventually serendipitous - outcome. This colourful, fast-paced short animation won Best Animation at the Singapore Short Film Awards 2011.

results.title: Big Game
results.creator_credit: Jarrod Hasenjager and The Animation School (Cape Town)
results.brief_description:
Bobo, a lonely monster, is set to spend another birthday alone, until a cunning monster hunter throws him a killer surprise party!

results.title: Angelica Mesiti: The Calling interview
results.creator_credit: Jesse Taylorsmith, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick, ACMI and Ian Potter Cultural Trust
results.brief_description:
In this interview (filmed as part of activities associated with the ACMI Exhibition ‘Angelica Mesiti: The Calling’) the artist reflects on the structure, approach and the processes involved in creating the work.

‘The Calling’ is a three channel video installation that focuses on whistling languages, ancient forms of non-verbal communication which are still used in 2013 to communicate in isolated and difficult landscapes.

To conduct research for ‘The Calling’, artist Angelica Mesiti travelled to the village of Kuskoy in Northern Turkey, the island of La Gomera in The Canary Islands and the Island of Evia in Greece where whistling languages are still in use.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jesse Taylorsmith, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick, ACMI and Ian Potter Cultural Trust

results.title: Spectacle Talks: Gotye and his Collaborators
results.creator_credit: Gotye, Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Multi award-winning musician, songwriter and producer Gotye is no stranger to collaboration. His music videos are a testament to this, utilising the talents of diverse directors, artists and animators. Often involving a range of complex animation and filmmaking techniques, visual worlds are created floating seamlessly against his music.
Natasha Pincus, Andrew Goldsmith, and directors of Rubber House animation studio Ivan Dixon and Greg Sharp disscus a selection of Gotye’s most renowned videos. These include ‘Easy Way Out’, ‘Seven Hours With A Back Seat Driver’, ‘State Of The Art’ and the international chart-topping ‘Somebody That I Used To Know’.
Hosted by film and music critic Megan Spencer, this event provided a fascinating insight into the collaborative journey, from initial concept and creative development, through to final clip production.

results.title: Voyager [game trailer]
results.brief_description: In a faraway world lived two clans, Dezminus and Akai. Their only connection was a trade route, trading Dezminus’ ores for Akai’s wheat. But one day Dezminus’s food supplies stopped coming. So Dezminus decided to declare war and conquer the Clan of Akai. So they sent a warship to declare war on Akai. The captain of that vessel was…you.

results.title: The Mansion [game trailer]
results.brief_description: It’s a moonless night… Let’s go explore a mansion. In ‘The Mansion’, a nameless character finds himself with the task of searching an old mansion. Although he can’t understand the lost children it doesn’t take a true connection to know only he can help. The story is told through a platformer format, inspired by games such as Super Mario Bros.

results.creator_credit: Bailey Humphries, Emma Reid and Olivia Walker
results.brief_description: Grandma Swift laments her disconnectedness from the outside world, a quick idea takes a comical journey through modern and old time methods of communication leading to a modern day twist at the end.

results.title: Closure
results.brief_description: A young girl reflects on her connections with her family and friends and she attempts to discover why she feels like she is being ignored. She focuses on the experiences from her past but continually feels an intrinsic connection to water. Only later does she discover why this is the case.

results.title: Visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: Ethan Hawkins, Ethan Price, Luke Breaden and Riley Elson
results.brief_description: My name is Mick and I enjoy lots of exciting activities but not the activity of visiting Grandpa every Sunday. That is, until I find a photo album and discover I have more in common with Grandpa than I can imagine. Come and explore how two different people make a connection.
